one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read Acts 9:31-43.
Peter performed miracles during a period of peace for the Church.

questions.questionText: 4. What do you learn about God from the miracles in this passage? How does that encourage or inspire you?
5. Whom and how can you serve as you share the gospel with others?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read Acts 10.
God poured out the Holy Spirit on the Gentiles.

questions.questionText: 6. Describe Cornelius. What was missing in his life?
7. a. What did God command Peter to do? What objections did Peter have?
7. b. How did God confirm His commands to Peter?
8. What great event changed the separation between Jews and Gentiles? (See 10:34-43.) What barriers in your world could the gospel remove?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read Acts 11:1-18.
Peter defended his actions to his critics.

questions.questionText: 9. Why would earnest Jewish Christians of Acts 11:2 criticize Peter?
10. How did Peter demonstrate faith in God and faithfulness to the truth in his report?
11. What do you learn about God and following Him? How does this encourage you in your current situation?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Acts 11:19-30.
Barnabas and Saul ministered to believers in Antioch.

questions.questionText: 12. Describe the Antioch church and its activities?
13. What is God calling you to do to serve others? What action step(s) could you ask your group to pray for?
14. What did you learn about God, and what did you learn about yourself?
